thread.section_title: Fort Greene and DUMBO Top Stories on DNAinfo - Wednesday, March 15, 2017 | 10:42pm
thread.title: 6 New Restaurants to Try This Week
thread.title_full: 6 New Restaurants to Try This Week

title: 6 New Restaurants to Try This Week
text:
6 New Restaurants to Try This Week By DNAinfo Staff | August 23, 2016 3:22pm | Updated on March 15, 2017 3:45pm Twitter Facebook Email More The Fat Monk, 949 Columbus Ave., Upper West Side A post shared by The Fat Monk (@thefatmonknyc) on Mar 7, 2017 at 4:36pm PST 
Open Since: Late February 2017 Type of Cuisine: Gastropub 
This gastropub — from Rob McCue of “Hell’s Kitchen” Season 8 — is serving up classic British fare like fish and chips, burgers, and lamb shepherd’s pie, but it’s also putting its novel spin on things. The restaurant’s signature dishes include glass crackled pork knuckles, foie gras bratwurst, raw oysters finished with Pernod parsley crust, and braised miso monkfish, according to its website. Order a cleverly named cocktail, like “My Lisa Frank Notebook” or “Beet Box,” to cap your meaty meal here. Madison Barrel, 766 Seneca Ave., Ridgewood 
Open Since: February 2017 Type of Cuisine: Traditional American, Breakfast, Brunch & Dinner 
Try this new diner-style eatery in Ridgewood which serves up a large selection of American classic dishes, from eggs Benedict and Western omelet to cheeseburger, chicken tenders, pork chops and grilled New York sirloin steak. The menu also includes several Mexican and Greek options, like quesadillas and moussaka. Brooklyn Roasting Company, 45 Washington St., DUMBO Our new cafe at 45 Washington St in DUMBO, Brooklyn is open! Stop by for superb, sustainable coffee & our always unique design aesthetic. pic.twitter.com/cfjMD1wk2R — Brooklyn Roasting Co (@BklynRoasting) March 9, 2017 
Open Since: March 9 Type of Cuisine: Coffee 
Brooklyn Roasting Company ’s third DUMBO location is now open, serving the shop’s sustainably sourced coffee and espresso, as well as a variety of snacks. The new location’s retro design features reclaimed furniture, a lighting installation made with gramophones and vintage checkerboard patterned floors. GoodFellas Pizzeria of LIC, 25-19 40th Ave., Long Island City 
Open Since: Early February Type of Cuisine: Pizza/Italian 
This casual slice joint serves up hand-tossed pies, both New York-style and Chicago deep-dish, according to its Yelp page , where one reviewer declares it “a great place for take out or a quick bite.” The menu also includes calzones, chicken wings, salads and pasta dishes. Turntable LP Bar and Karaoke, 36 W. 32nd St., Midtown 
Open Since: January Type of Cuisine: Pan-Asian 
Chow down on food from this eclectic menu, which draws on Japanese and Korean traditions, before letting loose at karaoke. Calabria, 266 Kingston Ave., Crown Heights A post shared by Crown Heights Brooklyn (@calabria.pizza) on Mar 9, 2017 at 5:16am PST 
Open Since: March 7 Type of Cuisine: Kosher pizza 
Try the square “New York-style” pizza at this new gourmet take-out spot on the corner of Lincoln Place and Kingston Avenue in Crown Heights. Everything on the menu is kosher and includes vegan options as well. The eatery caused something of a stir when it opened earlier this month directly across the street from a well-known kosher restaurant, which sued in rabbinical court to stop the competition, according to The Forward.
